The 2007 USAPL North Carolina State Powerlifting Championships were held August 11th at Bunn High School near Raleigh
big success! This is the first time since the mid 1980’s in Princeton
column2: NC that a USAPL/ADFPA meet was held near the Raleigh area. Nearly 40

column1: lifters competed for the bragging rights of State Champion in Equipped Full Power & Bench Press and Raw Full Power & Bench Press.
Best Lifters were Michael Neal in the Raw Powerlifting Division with a huge 1929lb. total (SHW)
column2: and Todd Shelton in the Equipped Powerliftng
total (220). Michael and Todd displayed great sportsmanship and class through the entire contest

column1: inspirational for all spectators and lifters that were present.
Both the Equipped and Raw divisions were populated with lifters of all levels of experience and ability. Many lifters of all ages were there to

column2: while other USAPL veterans of up to 25 years competed. There were also current and past USAPL National

column1: We would like to thank Pete Alaniz of Titan Support Systems for contributing two very cool looking Katana swords and gift certificates for our
Best Lifter awards. We would also like to thank everyone who volunteered their valuable weekend time to spot and load
running very smoothly and safely. Jennifer and Donovan Thompson were vital in the success of the meet by providing the equipment and

column2: during and after the event. The scoring table crew was nearly flawless and the judges were as consistent as you will find.
